messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the quiet season
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/21/2005 11:03:11 PM Central Standard Time, SandraDodd@aol.com writes: Then  it s kinda constant until spring again, when it slacks  off.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/21/2005 11:03:11 PM Central Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

Then it's kinda constant until
spring again, when it slacks off.



~~~~
And we're all out *doing* stuff, enjoying the wonderful weather. I almost
missed the finales of two of my favorite shows, just because it was spring!

Karen

www.badchair.net


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the quiet season
messages.msgSnippet: Glad you posted this.  I was beginning to think maybe my cyber-deodorant was not working :-) Tami, who is busy dealing with potty learning, teething, and a
messages.messageBody:
Glad you posted this. I was beginning to think maybe my cyber-deodorant was
not working :-)

Tami, who is busy dealing with potty learning, teething, and a husband who
brought back a most bizarre flu bug as a souvenir from Thailand. Sometimes
life is a challenge!

-----Original Message-----
From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of
SandraDodd@...
Sent: Sunday, May 22, 2005 1:03 PM
To: unschoolingdiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the quiet season

For the benefit of of some of the new and enthusiastic list members, I
wanted to say that this is probably the quietest time of year for
homeschooling
discussions of any kind. Those who might want to homeschool next year
aren't
feeling the pressure yet. Those who are thinking of changing to
unschooling
from a more structured kind of homeschooling were planning to have the
summer
"off" anyway, and will ask "when school starts."

I haven't tracked it really closely, but there seems to be a surge in late
summer, and then (for unschooling, at least) around October and November,
when
people have tried school again and quit in disgust, or bought a curriculum
and kids and mom all are in tears about it all. Then it's kinda constant
until
spring again, when it slacks off.

Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

For the benefit of of some of the new and enthusiastic list members, I
wanted to say that this is probably the quietest time of year for homeschooling

"off" anyway, and will ask "when school starts."

I haven't tracked it really closely, but there seems to be a surge in late

people have tried school again and quit in disgust, or bought a curriculum
